channel.title: How do i change the xp that something gives?
channel.description: I am fairly new to this so go easy on me. I just made a decent server, but if u click the door twice u get a 99 stat, i dont want stats to be that easy. N e 1 know how i would change the xp that somethings gives? thanks, Control.

item.title: How do i change the xp that something gives?
item.dc:creator: @ham8legs ham8legs
item.description:
@ham8legs wrote:

ok you see

addSkillXP((1200*playerLevel[0]), 0); addSkillXP((300*playerLevel[3]), 3);
or somthing like that well

addSkillXP((1200*playerLevel[0]), 0);

this is telling you that this is how much exp its giving you until your lvl 3 then when your lvl 3 it gives you 399 exp

You can if you want but i didnt

Read full topic

item.title: How do i change the xp that something gives?
item.dc:creator: @ham8legs ham8legs
item.description:
@ham8legs wrote:

"addSkillXP((1200*playerLevel[0]), 0);" into addSkillXP((2400*playerLevel[0]), 0);
ok you see the 1200 and 2400 thats how much exp it gives you per hit and if you want it even better xp you raise it
ok go and look at my tutorial

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,109864.0.html

Read full topic

item.title: How do i change the xp that something gives?
item.dc:creator: @Controlkill Controlkill
item.description:
@Controlkill wrote:

Yer…uhhh Gawd, i got a question…
(dw its not “whats the meaning of life?”

Say i do wanna make it giv more xp and turn
"addSkillXP((1200playerLevel[0]), 0);"
into addSkillXP((2400playerLevel[0]), 0);

Do I do anything to the other “addskillxp’s…” below the one that says 300 and 150…if u get me.
For example,
I change the first one from 1200 to 2400, would i change 300 to 600?
Sorry if im being difficult lol.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i change the xp that something gives?
item.dc:creator: @i0wnuall i0wnuall
item.description:
@i0wnuall wrote:

ok say u wanna change the attack xp u would look up:You Attack The Dummy(this will be in your client.java)…and once u look u should see case 823: if (actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You Attack The Dummy."); setAnimation(0x326); addSkillXP((1200*playerLevel[0]), 0); addSkillXP((300*playerLevel[3]), 3); addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[18]), 18); actionTimer = 12; } break;
or somthing like that but the:addSkillXP((1200*playerLevel[0]), 0);
thats attack so if u wantedto double the attack xp u would change the 1200 to 2400 but 1200 is for me it will probably be like 300 or 500 so yeh there yeh go hope it helped![br][size=1]Posted on: April 06, 2007, 10:41:26 AM[/size][hr]ok i just re-read it. when u get the code addSkillXP((1200*playerLevel[0]), 0); than you would decrese the 1200 to about 600 or even lower if u want but mines 1200 becuase i have lvl 135 stats

Read full topic
